intro: Ornithopus pygmaeus, commonly known as the dwarf sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers and basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. It thrives in coastal environments and well-drained soils, often growing in sandy or rocky areas. Ornithopus pygmaeus is typically found in dunes and coastal grasslands, where it plays a role in stabilizing sand and supporting local biodiversity.
